required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tiotropium Respimat Pharmacokinetic Study in COPD
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomised, Placebo- and Active-controlled, 5 Way, Crossover Trial to Characterise the Pharmacokinetics and Evaluate the Bronchodilator Efficacy and Safety of Once-daily Tiotropium Delivered (Double-blind) From the Respimat Inhaler as Solution for Inhalation (1.25, 2.5, 5 mcg or Placebo) and as Inhalation Powder (18mcg) From the HandiHaler (Open Label) After 4 Week-treatment Periods in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is compare the effect of different doses of tiotropium delivered by the HandiHaler and Respimat device on lung function. Additionally, the study will investigate the pharmacokinetic profile of these different doses. Studying the pharmacokinetic profile shows what happens to the medication in the body over a period of hours and provides information on potential effects of the medication.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 minutes (min) before study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 hour (h), 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
primary_outcome.description: Cmax,ss is the maximum measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma at steady-state.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve 0 to 6 Hours at Steady-state (AUC0-6h,ss)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 minutes (min) before study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 hour (h), 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-6h,ss is the area under the concentration time curve of tiotropium in plasma over the time interval 0 to 6 hours post-dose at steady-state. AUC0-6h,ss was calculated using the linear up/log down algorithm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as FEV1 measured just prior to the last administration of the morning dose of the randomised treatment. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 Area Under the Curve 0 to 6 Hours (AUC0-6h) at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 AUC0-6h calculated from zero time to 6 hours using the trapezoidal rule divided by 6 hours. Trough FEV1 will be assigned to zero time. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 Area Under the Curve 0 to 3 Hours (AUC0-3h) at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 AUC0-3h calculated from zero time to 3 hours using the trapezoidal rule divided by 3 hours. Trough FEV1 will be assigned to zero time. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the pre-dose FVC measured just prior to the last administration of the morning dose of the randomised treatment. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: FVC AUC0-6h at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: FVC AUC0-6h calculated from zero time to 6 hours using the trapezoidal rule divided by 6 hours. Trough FVC will be assigned to zero time. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: FVC AUC0-3h at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: FVC AUC0-3h calculated from zero time to 3 hours using the trapezoidal rule divided by 3 hours. Trough FVC will be assigned to zero time. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 at Each Planned Time at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Means are adjusted for period, planned time, period*planned time, patient*planned time and patient*treatment*planned time.

secondary_outcome.measure: FVC at Each Planned Time at the End of Each Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Means are adjusted for period, planned time, period*planned time, patient*planned time and patient*treatment*planned time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve 0 to 1 Hour at Steady-state (AUC0-1h,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 minutes (min) before study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 hour (h), 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-1h,ss is the area under the concentration time curve of tiotropium in plasma over the time interval 0 to 1 hour post-dose at steady-state. AUC0-1h,ss was calculated using the linear up/log down algorithm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Tmax,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 min before first dosing of study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 h, 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax,ss is the time from dosing to the maximum concentration of tiotropium in plasma-venous blood at steady-state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Drug Eliminated in Urine at Steady-state (Ae0-6h,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on urine sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks in the following intervals: -1 to 0 hour (h), 0 to 2 h and 2 to 6 h post-dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Total quantity of the analyte that is excreted in urine over the time interval 0 to 6 hours at steady state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time point: 5 minutes (min) before first dosing of study drug (baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Cpre,ss is the measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma before dosing at steady-state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on blood and urine sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks over 6 h post dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Renal clearance of the drug over the time interval 0 to 6 hours at steady-state. CL R,0-6h,ss was calculated as the quotient of Ae0-6h,ss and AUC0-6h,ss.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 min before first dosing of study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 h, 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Cmin,ss is the minimum measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma at steady-state.

other_outcome.description: Maximum HR evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

Mean HR evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) event evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) run evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. Runs were defined as at least 3 premature beats in a row. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) pair evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. Pairs were defined as 2 consecutive premature beats in a row. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) single evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Ventricular Premature Beat (VPB) event evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Ventricular Premature Beat (VPB) run evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. Runs were defined as at least 3 premature beats in a row. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Ventricular Premature Beat (VPB) pair evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. Pairs were defined as 2 consecutive premature beats in a row. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Ventricular Premature Beat (VPB) single evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. All patient must sign an informed consent consistent with IInternational Conference on Harmonisation- Good Clinical Practice (ICH-GCP) guidelines and local legislation prior to any study-related procedures, including medication washout and restrictions.
2. Relatively stable, moderate to very severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
3. Current or ex-smokers (smoking history of at least 10 pack years)
4. Able to perform lung function tests
5. Able to use study inhalers
Exclusion criteria:
1. Significant diseases other than COPD
2. Recent myocardial infarction, unstable or life-threatening cardiac arrhythmia, hospitalisation for cardiac failure.
3. Malignancy requiring resection, radiation therapy or chemotherapy within the last 5 years
4. History of asthma, life-threatening pulmonary obstruction, cystic fibrosis or clinically evident bronchiectasis 5 Active tuberculosis
6. History of alcohol or drug abuse 7. Pulmonary resection 8. Recent completion of a pulmonary rehabilitation program or current participation which will not be continued 9. Daytime oxygen therapy for more than 1 hour per day. 10. Use of other investigational drugs, restrictions on the use of some respiratory medications during the study period.
11. Current participation in another clinical trial 12. Pregnant or nursing women 13. Women of childbearing potential not using a highly effective method of contraception (e.g: implants, injectable, oral contraceptives)

group.title: Study Overall
group.description: Total number of patients randomised and treated in the study. This was a randomised 5-period crossover trial. 154 patients were randomised to one of 15 sequences and treated. The trial was blinded within the 4 Respimat treatments, but open for the HandiHaler treatment. Each of the 5 treatment regimens was taken for 4 weeks without washouts between treatment periods.

group.title: Study Overall
group.description: Total number of patients randomised and treated in the study.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Cmax,ss)
outcome.description: Cmax,ss is the maximum measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma at steady-state.
outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 minutes (min) before study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 hour (h), 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Set. This analysis set includes all patients in the treated set who had at least one blood sample drawn or one urine sample collected for PK analysis. Patients with an important protocol violation relevant to the PK population were excluded. No PK data for placebo. All patients with analysable data.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

group.title: Tio R1.25
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 1.25 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R2.5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 2.5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio HH18
group.description: Open-label tiotropium inhalation capsule 18 mcg delivered by the HandiHaler qd in the morning

measure.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Cmax,ss)
measure.description: Cmax,ss is the maximum measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma at steady-state.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Set. This analysis set includes all patients in the treated set who had at least one blood sample drawn or one urine sample collected for PK analysis. Patients with an important protocol violation relevant to the PK population were excluded. No PK data for placebo. All patients with analysable data.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The standard bioequivalence range of 80 to 125% was pre-specified for Cmax,ss in order to assess the relative systemic exposure following inhalation of Tio R5 compared to Tio HH18. Bioequivalence was not used as a surrogate for efficacy.
analysis.p_value_desc: Maximum of two one-sided p-values for geometric mean ratio being outside interval 80 percent to 125 percent.
analysis.estimate_desc: Standard deviation is actually the geometric coefficient of variation.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve 0 to 6 Hours at Steady-state (AUC0-6h,ss)
outcome.description: AUC0-6h,ss is the area under the concentration time curve of tiotropium in plasma over the time interval 0 to 6 hours post-dose at steady-state. AUC0-6h,ss was calculated using the linear up/log down algorithm.
outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 minutes (min) before study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 hour (h), 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
outcome.population: PK Set. No PK data for Placebo. The low number of non-missing AUC0-6h,ss results for the Tio R 1.25 and Tio R 2.5 cohorts is due to the exclusion of results below the limit of quantification.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

group.title: Tio R1.25
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 1.25 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

measure.title: Area Under the Curve 0 to 6 Hours at Steady-state (AUC0-6h,ss)
measure.description: AUC0-6h,ss is the area under the concentration time curve of tiotropium in plasma over the time interval 0 to 6 hours post-dose at steady-state. AUC0-6h,ss was calculated using the linear up/log down algorithm.
measure.population: PK Set. No PK data for Placebo. The low number of non-missing AUC0-6h,ss results for the Tio R 1.25 and Tio R 2.5 cohorts is due to the exclusion of results below the limit of quantification.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The standard bioequivalence range of 80 to 125% was pre-specified for AUC0-6,ss in order to assess the relative systemic exposure following inhalation of Tio R5 compared to Tio HH18. Bioequivalence was not used as a surrogate for efficacy.
analysis.p_value_desc: Maximum of two one-sided p-values for geometric mean ratio being outside interval 80 percent to 125 percent.
analysis.estimate_desc: Standard deviation is actually the geometric coefficient of variation.

outcome.title: Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) at the End of Each Treatment Period
outcome.description: Defined as FEV1 measured just prior to the last administration of the morning dose of the randomised treatment. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) with imputed data. FAS includes all patients in the treated set who have analysable data for at least one efficacy endpoint during the relevant crossover period.

measure.description: Defined as FEV1 measured just prior to the last administration of the morning dose of the randomised treatment. Means are adjusted for sequence, patients within sequences, period and treatment.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) with imputed data. FAS includes all patients in the treated set who have analysable data for at least one efficacy endpoint during the relevant crossover period.

outcome.population: FAS with imputed data.

outcome.population: FAS with imputed data. One patient with missing FVC data in Placebo and Tio R2.5 period.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve 0 to 1 Hour at Steady-state (AUC0-1h,ss)
outcome.description: AUC0-1h,ss is the area under the concentration time curve of tiotropium in plasma over the time interval 0 to 1 hour post-dose at steady-state. AUC0-1h,ss was calculated using the linear up/log down algorithm.
outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 minutes (min) before study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 hour (h), 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
outcome.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

group.title: Tio R1.25
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 1.25 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R2.5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 2.5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio HH18
group.description: Open-label tiotropium inhalation capsule 18 mcg delivered by the HandiHaler qd in the morning

measure.title: Area Under the Curve 0 to 1 Hour at Steady-state (AUC0-1h,ss)
measure.description: AUC0-1h,ss is the area under the concentration time curve of tiotropium in plasma over the time interval 0 to 1 hour post-dose at steady-state. AUC0-1h,ss was calculated using the linear up/log down algorithm.
measure.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

outcome.title: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Tmax,ss)
outcome.description: Tmax,ss is the time from dosing to the maximum concentration of tiotropium in plasma-venous blood at steady-state.
outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 min before first dosing of study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 h, 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
outcome.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

group.title: Tio R1.25
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 1.25 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R2.5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 2.5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio HH18
group.description: Open-label tiotropium inhalation capsule 18 mcg delivered by the HandiHaler qd in the morning

measure.title: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Tmax,ss)
measure.description: Tmax,ss is the time from dosing to the maximum concentration of tiotropium in plasma-venous blood at steady-state.
measure.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

outcome.title: Amount of Drug Eliminated in Urine at Steady-state (Ae0-6h,ss)
outcome.description: Total quantity of the analyte that is excreted in urine over the time interval 0 to 6 hours at steady state.
outcome.time_frame: Based on urine sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks in the following intervals: -1 to 0 hour (h), 0 to 2 h and 2 to 6 h post-dosing.
outcome.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

group.title: Tio R1.25
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 1.25 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R2.5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 2.5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio HH18
group.description: Open-label tiotropium inhalation capsule 18 mcg delivered by the HandiHaler qd in the morning

measure.title: Amount of Drug Eliminated in Urine at Steady-state (Ae0-6h,ss)
measure.description: Total quantity of the analyte that is excreted in urine over the time interval 0 to 6 hours at steady state.
measure.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

outcome.title: Pre-dose Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Cpre,ss)
outcome.description: Cpre,ss is the measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma before dosing at steady-state.
outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time point: 5 minutes (min) before first dosing of study drug (baseline)
outcome.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

group.title: Tio R1.25
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 1.25 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R2.5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 2.5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio HH18
group.description: Open-label tiotropium inhalation capsule 18 mcg delivered by the HandiHaler qd in the morning

measure.title: Pre-dose Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Cpre,ss)
measure.description: Cpre,ss is the measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma before dosing at steady-state.
measure.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

outcome.title: Renal Clearance at Steady-state (CL R,0-6h,ss)
outcome.description: Renal clearance of the drug over the time interval 0 to 6 hours at steady-state. CL R,0-6h,ss was calculated as the quotient of Ae0-6h,ss and AUC0-6h,ss.
outcome.time_frame: Based on blood and urine sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks over 6 h post dosing.
outcome.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

group.title: Tio R1.25
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 1.25 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R2.5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 2.5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio R5
group.description: Tiotropium inhalation solution 5 mcg delivered by the Respimat inhaler qd in the morning

group.title: Tio HH18
group.description: Open-label tiotropium inhalation capsule 18 mcg delivered by the HandiHaler qd in the morning

measure.title: Renal Clearance at Steady-state (CL R,0-6h,ss)
measure.description: Renal clearance of the drug over the time interval 0 to 6 hours at steady-state. CL R,0-6h,ss was calculated as the quotient of Ae0-6h,ss and AUC0-6h,ss.
measure.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

outcome.title: Minimum Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Cmin,ss)
outcome.description: Cmin,ss is the minimum measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma at steady-state.
outcome.time_frame: Based on blood sampling for PK assessments done at 4 weeks at the following time points: 5 min before first dosing of study drug (baseline) and at 2 min , 5 min, 7 min, 9 min, 12 min, 15 min, 20 min, 30 min, 40 min, 1 h, 2 h, 4 h and 6 h post dosing.
outcome.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

measure.title: Minimum Plasma Concentration at Steady-state (Cmin,ss)
measure.description: Cmin,ss is the minimum measured concentration of tiotropium in plasma at steady-state.
measure.population: PK Set. All patients with analysable data.

outcome.title: Maximum Heart Rate (HR)
outcome.description: Maximum HR evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.
outcome.population: ECGFAS - including all patients in the treated set for whom continuous 12 lead ECGs (Holter monitoring) were recorded on at least one occasion (pacemaker patients were excluded).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching Placebo once daily (qd) delivered by the Respimat inhaler

measure.title: Mean Heart Rate (HR)
measure.description: Mean HR evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.
measure.population: ECGFAS - including all patients in the treated set for whom continuous 12 lead ECGs (Holter monitoring) were recorded on at least one occasion (pacemaker patients were excluded)

outcome.title: SVPB Total
outcome.description: The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) event evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.
outcome.population: ECGFAS - including all patients in the treated set for whom continuous 12 lead ECGs (Holter monitoring) were recorded on at least one occasion (pacemaker patients were excluded)

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: SVPB Total
measure.description: The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) event evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.
measure.population: ECGFAS - including all patients in the treated set for whom continuous 12 lead ECGs (Holter monitoring) were recorded on at least one occasion (pacemaker patients were excluded)

outcome.title: SVPB Runs
outcome.description: The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) run evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. Runs were defined as at least 3 premature beats in a row. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.
outcome.population: ECGFAS - including all patients in the treated set for whom continuous 12 lead ECGs (Holter monitoring) were recorded on at least one occasion (pacemaker patients were excluded)

The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.
measure.population: ECGFAS - including all patients in the treated set for whom continuous 12 lead ECGs (Holter monitoring) were recorded on at least one occasion (pacemaker patients were excluded)

outcome.description: The outcome measure describes the number of patients with a Supraventricular Premature Beat (SVPB) pair evaluated over the entire 6.5 h Holter monitoring period. Pairs were defined as 2 consecutive premature beats in a row. The arrhythmia variables were pre-specified for day 29 and analysed post-hoc for day 26. The lines "Day 29 1st h" and "Day 26 1st h" are related to the interval 0 h to 1 h, i.e. the first hour after dosing.
outcome.population: ECGFAS - including all patients in the treated set for whom continuous 12 lead ECGs (Holter monitoring) were recorded on at least one occasion (pacemaker patients were excluded)

event.sub_title: Infective exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication
